content: Pretty standard month, but things might start changing up with my partner leaving his job next month (currently job hunting, but there’s a definite end date to current employment). Good news is that he’s getting packaged out, ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ news is that everything else is up in the air. We’ll just keep doing the normal stuff until I start getting nervous, then my savings goals might change. Savings General Travel — Goal $infinityDecember: $952January: $119February: $1661 $200/month + extra when we have it. Bought some Norway transit tickets, otherwise this will be used for JoCo expenses and Norway expenses. Airline Travel — Goal $4000December: $3118January: $1334February: $0 Moved into the general travel fund — no plane trips upcoming. Retirement — Goal $1,200,000January: $135,112February: $144,152 This month was extra good because I front loaded funding our Roth IRAs — put $1900 in, with another $1900 planned for this month. It makes it so we can contribute $300/month/account for the rest of the year, which is a nice round number. This is for 2 people spread over 2 401ks, 2 Roth IRAs, and a couple non-retirement investment accounts. Goal is to contribute $2800/month and rely on compound interest to do the rest.
